snippet: The automaker has piled on cash incentives and cheap lease deals to invigorate sales of its passenger cars, particularly the smaller models.
abstract: General Motors, still reeling from costs associated with safety and recall crisis, has increasingly relied on cash incentives and cheap lease deals to invigorate sales; move has helped company maintain sales levels despite overwhelmingly negative attention; discounts have largely been associated with smaller cars, as company continues to turn profit on its SUV models.

byline.original: By AARON M. KESSLER and BILL VLASIC

lead_paragraph: The automaker has piled on cash incentives and cheap lease deals to invigorate sales of its passenger cars, particularly the smaller models.

headline.main: To Lift Sales, G.M. Turns to Discounts
headline.print_headline: To Lift Sales, G.M. Turns to Discounts
